alert.note: Alert for Caldwell; Clay; Clinton; Daviess; DeKalb (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 23 at 8:28PM CDT until April 23 at 9:15PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pleasant Hill has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Daviess County in north central Missouri... Clinton County in northwestern Missouri... Northwestern Clay County in west central Missouri... Caldwell County in north central Missouri... Southern DeKalb County in northwestern Missouri... * Until 915 PM CDT. * At 827 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Maysville to near Osborn to near Trimble, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Cameron, Plattsburg, Lathrop, Hamilton, Gallatin, Maysville, Stewartsville, Polo, Holt, Osborn, Breckenridge, Kingston, Kidder, Winston, Altamont, Turney, Jameson, Weatherby, Lock Springs and Amity. This includes Interstate 35 in Missouri between mile markers 33 and 74. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
